newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Autoliv, Morton unit to merge.
newsitem.headline: Autoliv, Morton unit to merge.

text.p: Swedish automotive safety group Autoliv -- one of Europe's biggest airbag makers -- said on Monday it had signed a letter of intent with the car safety unit of U.S. company Morton International regarding a merger of the two companies.
The merger would lead to the creation of a holding company, Autoliv Inc., whose head office would be in either Amsterdam or London, but whose legal domicile would be in the United States.

The merger is planned to take the form of a merger of equals, under which Autoliv AB's shareholders will exchange their shares for 53.5 percent of the shares in Autoliv Inc., and the shareholders in Morton International will exchange its ownership in ASP for 46.5 percent of the shares in Autoliv, Inc.
The board of the new company will initially consist of equal numbers from Autoliv AB and Morton International.
However, Gunnar Bark, who was Autoliv's Chief Executive Officer up to August 1996, will be chairman of the board, Autoliv said.
